result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy B Shumate was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prostitution-Nonmmarital Sexual Intercourse, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.30(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees while on probation on 15CF3211 or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.

Defendant Amy B Shumate in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Defendant Amy B Shumate in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by:  LORENZO M.

Defendant sentenced to serve SEVEN (7) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for SEVEN (7) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees WHILE ON PROBATION on 15CF3211 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant Amy B Shumate in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Defendant Amy B Shumate in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State RENEWED their Motion to REVOKE.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there IS a FACTUAL BASIS for the REVOCATION.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court heldThe defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Br. 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Amy B Shumate in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

DTC - PHASE I

Review Hearing proceeds.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds that the defendant is not in compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract.  State moved to REVOKE the DTC/DPA.  Court took that Motion to REVOKE under ADVISEMENT at this time.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  No points are awarded.  Sobriety date to be reset.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 33. Case set for return on warrant. Order to Cancel Warrant signed and filed. Arguments heard as to bail. Court set cash bail at $125.00 with turnover to justice point monitoring for placement. Cash bail to convert to a signature bond upon placement. Case adjourned to Branch 33. Case adjourned to Branch 33.

Defendant Amy B Shumate in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer for Gabriela A Leija.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Per Defense and JusticePoint,  matter calendared for Further Proceedings on 11-04-2015 at 01:30pm.  sdg
Drug Court Referral, filed.
